name: Doubletree Resort by Hilton, Central Pacific - Costa Rica

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice people, clean and cozy. The food was delicious, but the check- in is too late (3:00 p.m.). We spent all afternoon walking around the hotel waiting for the room. People are especially polite, friendly and helpful.The beach has strong waves and is not to swimmers, but it has beautiful scenery.
reviews.title: Nice people

reviews.text: As a diamond member I received excellent service. The resort amenities were nice particularly the pools. We enjoyed the 2 specialty restaurants particularly the seafood restaurant. The buffet was fine but we were glad to have had other options for two of three nights. We stayed in building three on the quieter side of the resort and the room was nice and comfortable. They did have a water outage for half a day in that bldg, and forgot to refresh our towels one day but overall it was a very nice room.
reviews.title: Three days in early July

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do not go for the beach. The water is very brown from the river runoff, the sand is likewise, and many locals use this area to body surf. However, the resort itself has plenty of amenities to compensate.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay in beautiful Costa Rica

reviews.text: It also provides a good hub for excursions. Our family did the catamaran to Tortuga Island and enjoyed it. But the highlight of the trip was the personal tour with Dimas at www.tratursa.com. He is a kind, honest, knowledgable guide and speaks English very well. He took us to see and feed monkeys and to the Tarcoles River for an alligator tour. After, he stopped by to give us a CD of pictures he took during our excursion. If you are there, call him and let him take your family around and make tour arrangements for you. You will be very happy you did.
reviews.title: Response to “Like a Carnival Cruise Ship That Ran Aground”

reviews.text: Overall, it was a good hotel for three nights for our family of four (kids 8 & 12). I would not plan more tha 3 nights here and if you are there definitely get in touch with Dimas and spend a day with him.
reviews.title: Staff is over the top Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from Costa Rica, Double Tree was our second destination, we stayed 2 nights here. I’ve to say we would never come back here again.
reviews.title: Bad location, old room, not so good food, ok staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is somewhat seem dangerous, nothing seem closed by, the area smell really bad.
reviews.title: A good place to crash and recharge.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food: We had all inclusive deal, but was informed that only if we booked for 3 nights to be able to go to those special restaurants. However, they did gave us a waiver for 1 dinner. Restaurant Macondo wasn’t all that great either, I had red snapper and it was not fresh at all and smelly. Hubby had steak, they cooked at the table but wasn’t good either. Buffet food wasn’t that great and very limited choices.
reviews.title: Totally Recommend, Please read

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beach: dirty water, brown/black dirty looking sand that I didn’t even want to walk on it. Worse than our local beach in the states.
reviews.title: Don't Expect Much

reviews.text: The resort was empty, and we asked for a king bed, and the staff said that they don’t have any more king bed. Later on he informed us that we have to pay $30 extra a night, umm no thank you. We travel a lot and never had problem with asking for a King bed. Our bathroom leaked and won’t flush, we keep have to call the front desk. TV wasn’t clear.
reviews.title: Not terrible but not great either.

reviews.text: I attended a conference at the Doubletree Puntarenas, and I have to say that the hotel staff did an excellent job of managing such a large group. I think that from top to bottom, the staff at this hotel is really wonderful. Everybody we interacted with was great.
reviews.title: It was ok, but I wouldn't choose it again

reviews.text: The hotel itself is pretty good - not great, but pretty good. The biggest downside is the location - the beach is not very good. The water is very silty and brown from a big silty river that empties into the ocean nearby and there is a lot of debris in the water, also from that river - not really trash, but rather pieces of trees, foliage, etc. And the sand is very course - not nice for walking on. And the town around the resort is kind of run down - it is ok, but not really much to do or see there. One upside of the location though is that it is easy to get to from SJ and then easy to get from Puntarenas to other places like Jaco.
reviews.title: Clean, Good Food and Activities for the family

reviews.text: Our room was comfortable, although could use some TLC. Everything was really clean, just on the worn side. We had rusty fixtures in the bathroom, a broken leg on one of the beds that had to be fixed - that kind of thing.
reviews.title: Nice but not Hilton

reviews.text: The dining areas are nice and the food is decent - some is really good, some is just ok. They cook for a lot of people every night in the buffet restaurants, which I know can be a challenge. There isn't much creativity in the food, but overall it is pretty good. We were disappointed by the a la carte restaurants though because all 4 nights we stayed, they were totally full. The first day we arrived, we tried to make a reservation for any night, any restaurant and couldn't - no space. Disappointing.
reviews.title: Not lovin the Doubletree

reviews.text: The pool areas were nice - lots of different inlets and spaces, so you could find the party area or relaxation you are looking for. Also different swim up bars. There are plenty of lounge chairs, but they need more shade - people played the towel game and got the shady spots early.
reviews.title: Great staff but a lot of not so good. Definitely not up to Doubletree/Hilton standards.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I visited Costa Rica in junewith my husband to start the cealing room has mildew all over, they just swepet the floor never mopped during my stay the food was ok. the shows ok ,what bother me more was whent my husband and me try to go out of the hotel everything was imposible they told we can go out because we can be assault we try to rent a car and they told us that we can drive because the road was danger and we don't know the country always was somenthing,it was because they has some guys outside to take you in a tour and they take commision of that I did arragement for my tranfers before with this girl at the hotel for a price and when the chofer call me he charge more for the transfers the same chofer during the trip from san jose to punta arenas was telling us he was the more honest men in this world and my husband and me was like suspicious when he told us to don't talk to nobody else about tours not the office outside the hotel not the people in the beach at the hotel because those people will ripoff my husband and me decide to go outside to check prices and surprise! the prices were a lot cheaper my recomendation don't go without tours and transfer included in your trip. another tip don't go for june or july there a lot of teenagers the night before I leave I couldn't sleep because they were screaming at the halls even fighting.no good at all
reviews.title: is not a hilton quality

reviews.text: It is not located in a great tourist area, and they did not recommend we walk off of the grounds, but as long as we were on the grounds or on an excursion or in a taxi, everything was great! The landscaping, pools, and rooms were beautiful and very clean. The employees were extremely customer service focused! In fact, being a single mom with my two teenagers in central america could have been a scary experience, but the Hilton Doubletree employees, resort, activities, and excursions made us feel very safe and we had a blast!
reviews.title: This resort is done right!

reviews.text: I do want to pay a special compliment to the Hilton Honors staff at the resort, managed by Ana. On our first full day at the resort, my 15 year old daughter attempted to kayak and the waves pushed it into her face. The first aid gentleman and I thought it might have broken her nose. Ana helped with all arrangements for seeing a doctor in town and one of the nice ladies actually accompanied us and stayed with us the entire time, as we didn't speak spanish and the locals didn't speak much english. I couldn't have asked for better service. She took care of us and helped with the entire process, even made sure we were not overcharged by the taxi driver.
reviews.title: What a wonderful vacation at the Doubletree

reviews.text: The only semi-negative comments I would make, which would not keep me from returning, are that the ocean/beach at the resort is not conducive for swimming or snorkeling, and...the hotel has apparently opened up their property to locals for a reduced price on the weekends. The pools and facilities were very crowded on Friday evening and Saturday. This was only a bad thing trying to find a beach chair around the pools.
reviews.title: Like a Carnival Cruise Ship That Ran Aground

reviews.text: In summary, if you are looking for crystal clear waters for diving, snorkeling, or even swimming, this is not your place. But if you are interested in tours of rainforests, volcanos, wildlife, and a beautiful resort to stay in that offers activities for all age groups, this is the place!!
reviews.title: Ok hotel, with Friendly Staff

aka: Doubletree Resort By Hilton, Central Pacific - Costa Rica Hotel El Roble
description: The closest all-inclusive resort to San Jose! Doubletree Resort by Hilton Costa Rica - Central Pacific is a modern, full-amenity, all-inclusive resort hotel. This beachfront Costa Rica Hilton hotel is perfectly situated on the Central Pacific region outside the port city of Puntarenas, Costa Rica. Located only 50 minutes West of Juan Santamaria International Airport (SJO) and the Costa Rican capital city of San Jose, and two hours south of Liberia International Airport (LIR). Buffet breakfast, lunch and dinner served daily. Snacks and drinks available all day long. Two a-la-carte restaurants open for dinner. All-day activities for adults, teenagers or children, nightly entertainment and lounge.
